image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles as he sits on a stage with a blue background

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he wants Vietnam to become one of Australia's "top-tier" partners as he wraps up a two-day visit to Hanoi after signing a raft of agreements including a package to help Vietnam decarbonise its economy.

title.children: Australia and Vietnam sign $105m decarbonisation agreement in Hanoi

image.altText: Li Shangfu salutes before delivering a speech at the Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore

items.synopsis: China's Minister of National Defence General Li Shangfu tells Asia's top security summit that his country seeks dialogue over confrontation with the US, despite refusing American demands for military-to-military talks.

title.children: Chinese defence minister says clash with US would be 'unbearable disaster' for the world

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

items.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann says he may still consider suing Brittany Higgins personally for defamation, in his first television interview since she accused him of raping her at Parliament House in 2019.

title.children: '50 per cent of the country think I’m a rapist': Bruce Lehrmann says he hasn't ruled out suing Brittany Higgins

image.altText: A middle aged woman with dark hair and glasses on head talks into a mic

items.synopsis: Senior officials from about two dozen of the world's major intelligence agencies, including Australia, hold a closed-door meeting on the fringes of the Shangri-La Dialogue security conference.

title.children: World's spy chiefs meet in secret conclave in Singapore

image.altText: A side profile of Mr Chandler-Mather, who is looking off camera.

items.synopsis: The federal government's signature housing policy to establish a $10 billion future fund for social and affordable housing has been stalled for weeks. The Greens are offering a further compromise to guarantee its passage.

title.children: Greens offer compromise to break housing stalemate

image.altText: Prison guard's back with key shown.

items.synopsis: The Department of Justice is accused of allowing prison guards to work in youth detention centres without valid working with children checks, as an expert warns of a "legal minefield" over other missing qualifications.

title.children: Guards at notorious WA youth detention centres accused of not having valid child safety checks

image.altText: A black and white image of Lorraine Peeters sitting on a chair at a table as a young girl

items.synopsis: Telling her truth helps Lorraine Peeters heal from the trauma of being snatched from her parents as a child and sexually abused while being trained to become a servant for wealthy non-Indigenous families.

title.children: 'I thought it was just a game': Horrific abuse at the hands of matron at Aboriginal girls home

image.altText: Philip Lowe wearing glasses and a suit sits at a table and speaks.

items.synopsis: Australian policymakers should stop using euphemisms to explain how badly people are faring, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: The 'short run' of Australia's economic crisis has begun. How many years before we reach the 'long run'?

image.altText: A landfill site with a large white "membrane" over the top.

items.synopsis: The closure of north Queensland’s largest landfill has sparked a massive rehabilitation operation that will result in the site being "capped" to look like a natural hill. But what is the true cost of burying the region’s waste?

title.children: What happens when a landfill reaches its limits?

image.altText: A dark blue F1 car is just ahead of a red F1 car through a corner on a race track.

items.synopsis: The Dutchman secured pole position by almost half a second on Saturday, while his nearest rival and teammate Sergio Perez could not even make the top-10.

title.children: Max Verstappen dominating in Spain as Ferrari falls behind Mercedes

image.altText: The shell of a burned-out car on the back of a tow truck.

items.synopsis: A man is charged with causing grievous bodily harm to his wife, who has serious burns to more than a third of her body after fleeing from a flaming car in Perth's east.

title.children: Husband charged over fire that left woman in intensive care after fleeing from burning car

image.altText: Old photo of race cars in town

items.synopsis: Albany's motor race is one of only two left in the country where cars can hurtle around the streets.

title.children: Australia's 'Monaco' is one of the oldest car races in the world

image.altText: Roger Cook speaking to the media, with deputy Rita Saffioti in the background.

items.synopsis: Incoming WA premier Roger Cook refuses to be drawn on the potential makeup of his front bench, saying he wants to let the process take its course.

title.children: Incoming WA premier tight-lipped on reshuffle in first public appearance since McGowan's exit

image.altText: Rescuers rest in the shade of a passenger train that derailed

items.synopsis: Officials say the derailment in eastern India that killed 275 people and injured hundreds was caused by an error in the electronic signalling system that led a train to wrongly change tracks and crash into a freight train.

title.children: Error in signalling system led to India's deadly train crash, official says

image.altText: A group of young Israeli soldiers, four women and a man, stand on a rocky road comforting each other.

items.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the killing of three soldiers by a member of the Egyptian security services is a terrorist attack and is demanding an "exhaustive and thorough" investigation.

title.children: Israel demands Egypt's help in full probe of 'tragic terrorist attack' at border

image.altText: House on fire in the early morning, after shelling which has damaged buildings in a village.

items.synopsis: Shelling in Russia's Belgorod region has continued after two people were killed on Saturday and hundreds of children were evacuated, according to the region's governor.

title.children: Russian children evacuated as 'quite relentless' shelling continues to hit Belgorod

image.altText: Australia bowler Josh Hazlewood appeals for a wicket with both arms outsretched.

items.synopsis: The 32-year-old played only three games in the recent Indian Premier League after a side injury flared up while he also grappled with a left Achilles issue.

title.children: Josh Hazlewood ruled out of World Test Championship final through injury

image.altText: Sam Draper smiles and hugs a teammate

items.synopsis: Essendon won an absorbing clash against a desperate North Melbourne by a single goal in a thriller at Docklands. Earlier, Marlion Pickett's late goal earns Richmond a six-point win over GWS.

title.children: Essendon wins thriller against North Melbourne, Tigers clinch a close one against Giants

image.altText: a league player passes the ball at a match

items.synopsis: NSW Police say they were called to the hotel on South Head Road in Sydney's eastern suburbs just before midnight on Saturday.

title.children: Parramatta Eels star charged with sexual touching after incident at Sydney hotel

image.altText: An older man standing near a draw of snail shells.

items.synopsis: John Stanisic has one life mission — to get everyone to love snails and slugs.

title.children: What it takes to be The Snail Whisperer, spreading the Australian snail gospel

image.altText: A photo of the iconic archway in Melbourne's Chinatown surrounded by red paper lanterns.

items.synopsis: As Chinatown struggles to return to its pre-COVID golden age, younger generations have been busy creating cultural hubs of their own.

title.children: 'It's not Disneyland': Is Chinatown worth reviving? Or is it just a facade for tourists?

image.altText: An illustration of a destroyed Nokia phone and a close up shot of its IMEI number.

items.synopsis: Political editor Andrew Probyn reveals Australian intelligence's critical role in undoing the men who committed the 2002 Bali bombings — and how a shard from a Nokia phone brought them down.

title.children: How spies used a shard of an exploded Nokia phone to expose the Bali bombers

image.altText: A woman holds her new born baby in a hospital ward

items.synopsis: Over a decade, she went through a tragic stillbirth, 16 rounds of IVF, and hundreds of thousands of dollars. She says clinics behaved more like a business than a health service.

title.children: Treacy had 16 rounds of IVF with no success. It was an acupuncturist's words that led her to a breakthrough

image.altText: A smiling elderly woman holds open a christmas card with a black and white photo on it.

items.synopsis: When anti-Vietnam war protesters rocked Harold Holt's car, his secretary Jan Drury had to be pulled through the passenger-side window. That's just one of her memories of working for the prime minister who went for a swim and never returned.

title.children: Harold Holt's secretary remembers what it was like to work for the prime minister who disappeared

image.altText: A black and white photo of Edith Emery as a young woman, her chin resting in her hand

items.synopsis: Edith Emery's life reads like something from a Hollywood movie script — a successful career as a doctor cut short by Hitler's invasion of Austria, a long-distance romance that landed her in a prisoner of war camp, and her final chapter, breaking new ground in Tasmania.

title.children: 'It is as much as one could hope to squeeze into a single life': The remarkable story of Edith Emery

image.altText: An image of a winnie the pooh storybook talking about run, hide, fight

items.synopsis: Pooh's shift into the public domain sees the loveable teddy appear in some unlikely material.

title.children: 'Run, hide, fight': How Winnie the Pooh and Piglet are teaching kids in Texas about school shootings

image.altText: A man aged around 70 pictured from the left holding a budgie

items.synopsis: Les Trumper is among budgerigar breeders across Australia vying for a place on their state team so they can compete in the national title.

title.children: 'Good strong legs' and a dramatic bouffant: The competition for Australia's most beautiful budgies

image.altText: Queensland Firebirds players smile and hug each other

items.synopsis: The NSW Swifts rise to the top of the standings, seeing off a third-quarter challenge to defeat the Giants 68-63 at a sold-out Ken Rosewall Arena.

title.children: Firebirds' Indigenous stars shine in boilover victory, Swifts top Super Netball ladder

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne.

items.synopsis: Former Hawks welfare manager Jason Burt rejects the allegations made by ex-players and their families in an open letter on Friday.

title.children: Former Hawthorn official Jason Burt denies allegations in Indigenous families' open letter

image.altText: An old coloured photo of two smiling men in the outback, blue sky, red earth, stand next to ta film camera. Both w

items.synopsis: From gun-slinging stand-offs to scorched testicles, the surviving half of the Leyland Brothers has plenty of stories left to tell.

title.children: Leyland Brothers put life and loins on the line for adventure, but the surviving half isn't giving up yet
